description:
As a direct continuation of the first season, Zero comes back after his disappearance from the academy. Despite her relief, Yuuki, whose past is still shrouded in mystery, wonders what exactly happened to Zero during the separation. As Zero continues having the strange vision that appeared since the day he drank Kaname’s blood, he visits the now awakened Maria Kurenai in an attempt to find answers. She only provides him with a cryptic answer that suggests who the true enemy really might be.

In the meantime, vampires from the Supreme Vampire Council arrive at the academy in order to punish Zero with death for his sin of killing a pureblood. However, Kaname intervenes with the council's decision with not only the intention of saving Zero but with another purpose unbeknown to everyone around him.

[Written by MAL Rewrite]

tags.name: Vampire

tags.description: Features sexual or romantic relations between characters who are related by blood.

tags.description: Features characters attending a boarding school.

tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Male Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several male characters who are romantically interested in them.

myspace: @naoya_kazuya  ON/OFF duo consists of the Sakamoto (坂本) twins, Naoya (直弥) and Kazuya (和弥). Naoya is older twin brother and Kazuya is younger twin brother.

Mana is a Japanese musician and fashion designer, famed for his role as a leader and guitarist of the influential visual kei band Malice Mizer. It is said that he is widely considered the figurehead of Japan's Gothic Lolita fashion movement, as he helped popularize it. Moi dix Mois is Mana's current project.  

(Source: Wikipedia)

Originating from Studio Muu.


Married to fellow animator [Seiichi Nakatani](https://anilist.co/staff/107409/Seiichi-Nakatani).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/2876412506)

Representative director of [Felix Film](https://anilist.co/studio/6126/). Adept in animation and composite work.

**Bruno Méyère** is a French voice actor and director for anime.

**Non-anime roles:**
~!- A.J. in "Gutterballs" (French)
- Campbell in "Burn Notice" (French)
- Geek in "Astropia" (French)
- K.C. Guthrie in "Degrassi Next Generation" (French)
- Michelangelo in "Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles 2012" (French)!~

Affiliated with [Yumeta Company](https://anilist.co/studio/96/Yumeta-Company).

Worked as a composite artist in the beginning of his career.
